page.title: 11LANDSCAPE OF BROMPTON
page.content: Brompton is located at the eastern edge of the Vale of York.The village is surrounded by open countryside therefore giving the landscape a rural character.It is found in the valley of Brompton beck which flows from the north east and joins the River Wiske to the south west of the village.The land to the west is generally undulating,varying in height between 40 and 60 metres.To the south east it rises sharply from 40 to 100 metres above sea level.When the area is viewed from this point the most prominant features on the skyline are the church tower,the chimney from the old linen factory,the many red tiled and the slate roofs of the houses,the patchwork pattern of fields around the village and the individual farm houses that intersperse them.
